content.text:
Hey, congrats on the release! I'm excited to try it out.

I'm running sbot from Patchbay in the background and I'm gettting the same bug as above. Here's the actual error, from `--debug`:

```
TypeError: Cannot read property 'get' of undefined
    at Object.setMe [as set] (/home/christianbundy/Source/scat/node_modules/ssb-chat-core/state/actions.js:122:26)
    at connect.start (/home/christianbundy/Source/scat/node_modules/ssb-chat-core/index.js:54:18)
    at tryConnect (/home/christianbundy/Source/scat/node_modules/ssb-chat-core/connect/client.js:78:9)
    at client (/home/christianbundy/Source/scat/node_modules/ssb-chat-core/connect/client.js:44:9)
    at /home/christianbundy/Source/scat/node_modules/ssb-client/index.js:109:5
    at next (/home/christianbundy/Source/scat/node_modules/multiserver/compose.js:28:14)
    at /home/christianbundy/Source/scat/node_modules/multiserver/compose.js:34:9
    at _cb (/home/christianbundy/Source/scat/node_modules/multiserver/plugins/shs.js:31:11)
    at /home/christianbundy/Source/scat/node_modules/secret-handshake/protocol.js:120:7
    at Object.cb (/home/christianbundy/Source/scat/node_modules/secret-handshake/protocol.js:55:11)
```

Also, it looks like `npm ci` is currently broken. Was npm deprecated in favor of pnpm? :sweat_smile:
